page.title: 07Social concerns in Lytham
page.content: Near Pontin's Holiday Camp rubble and rubbish has been tipped.The Warden has spent a great deal of time and effort burying rubbish,and planting Marram Grass to stop the sand blowing away. Rabbits dig burrows in the side of the dunes.Smaller mammals also live on the Reserve.Voles,mice and Shrews. Hedgehogs hibernate under the Warden's cabin. In any season Skylarks are likely to be seen.In May the Starling can be heard,chattering away. Kestrels hover over the Reserve,and nest in the convalescent home across Clifton Drive. The Linnet,Stonechat and Meadow Pipit can also be seen on the Reserve.
